summary: This document is a chain of emails from June 2021 between a U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and the FBI regarding a request for financial documents related to a JP Morgan account held by Financial Trust Company. The emails specifically discuss obtaining a signature card and account statements to trace a $18,300,000 transfer to 'Maxwell' in October 1999.

persons.name: Comey, Maurene
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an email request for financial documents related to a JP Morgan account and a transfer to Maxwell.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the recipient of an $18,300,000 transfer from a Financial Trust Company account at JP Morgan in October 1999.

connections.description: Comey, as an AUSA, is investigating a financial transfer to Maxwell, indicating a legal/investigative connection.

events.title: $18.3M Transfer to Maxwell
events.description: A transfer of $18,300,000 from a JP Morgan Financial Trust Company account to an entity or person named Maxwell.

events.title: Document Request Initiated
events.description: AUSA Maurene Comey emails the FBI requesting the signature card for a specific JP Morgan account.

events.title: Account Statement Provided
events.description: An FBI contact provides an October 1999 account statement showing the $18.3M transfer to Maxwell and details its source from a money market fund sale.

locations: One Saint Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: A $18,300,000 transfer was made to 'Maxwell' from a JP Morgan Financial Trust Company account in October 1999.
The source of the funds for this transfer was the sale of a 'JP Morgan Institutional Prime Money Market Fund.'
In 2021, the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) was actively investigating this transaction, requesting signature cards and account statements.
The document is part of a larger document production related to financial accounts, referenced by Bates numbers (e.g., 36868, 1934).
